alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 10:19PM PST until February 22 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will start during the day Sunday mainly above 4000 feet. The bulk of the snow in Snoqualmie Pass and along I-90 is expected to occur Monday night through Wednesday morning. Snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches are expected for elevations below 3000 feet.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
